metadata.description:
This data set contains meteorological element observation data of heihe remote sensing station in the middle reaches of heihe hydrometeorological observation network from January 1, 2016 to December 31, 2016.The station is located in the east of dangzhai town, zhangye city, gansu province.The longitude and latitude of the observation point are 100.4756e, 38.8270n and 1560m above sea level.The air temperature and humidity sensor is located at 1.5m, facing due north.The barometer is in the waterproof box;The tilting bucket rain gauge is installed at 0.7 m;The wind speed and direction sensor is located at 10m, facing due north;The installation height of the four-component radiometer is 1.5m, facing due south;The installation height of the two infrared thermometers is 1.5m, facing due south and the probe facing vertically downward.The soil temperature probe is buried at 0cm on the surface and 2cm, 4cm, 10cm, 20cm, 40cm, 80cm, 120cm and 160cm underground.The soil water probe was buried at 2cm, 4cm, 10cm, 20cm, 40cm, 80cm, 120cm and 160cm.Average soil temperature probes were buried in 2cm and 4cm;The soil heat flow plate (3 pieces) is buried 6cm underground.Two photosynthetically active radiometers were set up 1.5m above the canopy (one probe vertically upwards and one probe vertically downwards), facing due south.
Observation projects are: air temperature and humidity (Ta_1. 5 m, RH_1. 5 m) (unit: c, percentage), pressure (Press) (unit: hundred mpa), precipitation (Rain) (unit: mm), wind speed (WS_10m) (unit: m/s), wind (WD_10m) (unit: degrees), the radiation of four component (DR, UR, DLR_Cor, ULR_Cor, Rn) (unit: watts per square meter), the surface radiation temperature (IRT_1, IRT_2) (unit:C), soil heat flux (Gs_1, Gs_2, Gs_3) (in watts/m2), soil temperature (Ts_0cm, Ts_2cm, Ts_4cm, Ts_10cm, Ts_20cm, Ts_40cm, Ts_80cm, Ts_120cm, Ts_160cm) (in:C), soil moisture (Ms_0cm, Ms_2cm, Ms_4cm, Ms_10cm, Ms_20cm, Ms_40cm, Ms_80cm, Ms_120cm, Ms_160cm) (unit: %), upward and downward photosynthetically active radiation (PAR_U_up, PAR_U_down) (unit: micromole/sq.s), mean soil temperature (TCAV) (unit: Celsius).
Processing and quality control of observed data :(1) ensure 144 pieces of data every day (every 10min), and mark by -6999 in case of data missing;2016.1.01-1.29 due to collector problems, many observation elements have more error values;(2) excluding the time with duplicate records;(3) data that obviously exceeds the physical significance or the range of the instrument is deleted;(4) the part marked with red letter in the data is the data in question;(5) date and time have the same format, and date and time are in the same column.For example, the time is: 2016-6-10-10:30;(6) the naming rule is: AWS+ site name.
For information of hydrometeorological network or station, please refer to Liu et al. (2018), and for observation data processing, please refer to Liu et al. (2011).
metadata.descriptionCn:
该数据集包含了2016年1月1日至2016年12月31日黑河水文气象观测网中游黑河遥感站气象要素观测数据。站点位于甘肃省张掖市党寨镇东侧，下垫面是人工草地。观测点的经纬度是100.4756E, 38.8270N，海拔1560m。空气温度湿度传感器架设在1.5m处，朝向正北；气压计在防水箱内；翻斗式雨量计安装在0.7 m处；风速风向传感器架设在10m处，朝向正北；四分量辐射仪安装高度为1.5m，朝向正南；两个红外温度计安装高度为1.5m，朝向正南，探头朝向是垂直向下；土壤温度探头埋设在地表0cm和地下2cm、4cm、10cm、20cm、40cm、80cm、120cm、160cm处；土壤水分探头埋设在2cm、4cm、10cm、20cm、40cm、80cm、120cm、160cm处；平均土壤温度探头埋设在2cm和4cm；土壤热流板（3块）依次埋设在地下6cm处；两个光合有效辐射仪分别架设在冠层上方1.5m（探头垂直向上和向下方向各一个），朝向正南。
观测项目有：空气温湿度（Ta_1.5m、RH_1.5m）(单位：摄氏度、百分比)、气压（Press）(单位：百帕)、降水量（Rain）(单位：毫米)、风速（WS_10m）(单位：米/秒)、风向（WD_10m）(单位：度)、四分量辐射（DR、UR、DLR_Cor、ULR_Cor、Rn）(单位：瓦/平方米)、地表辐射温度（IRT_1、IRT_2）(单位：摄氏度)、土壤热通量（Gs_1、Gs_2、Gs_3）(单位：瓦/平方米)、土壤温度（Ts_0cm、Ts_2cm、Ts_4cm、Ts_10cm、Ts_20cm、Ts_40cm、Ts_80cm、Ts_120cm、Ts_160cm）(单位：摄氏度)、土壤水分（Ms_0cm、Ms_2cm、Ms_4cm、Ms_10cm、Ms_20cm、Ms_40cm、Ms_80cm、Ms_120cm、Ms_160cm）(单位：%)、向上与向下光合有效辐射（PAR_U_up、PAR_U_down）(单位：微摩尔/平方米秒)、平均土壤温度（TCAV）（单位：摄氏度）。
观测数据的处理与质量控制：（1）确保每天144个数据（每10min），若出现数据的缺失，则由-6999标示；2016.1.01-1.29由于采集器问题，很多观测要素出现较多的错误值；（2）剔除有重复记录的时刻；（3）删除了明显超出物理意义或超出仪器量程的数据；（4）数据中以红字标示的部分为有疑问的数据；（5）日期和时间的格式统一，并且日期、时间在同一列。如，时间为：2016-6-10 10:30；（6）命名规则为：AWS+站点名称。
水文气象网或站点信息请参考Liu et al. (2018)，观测数据处理请参考Liu et al. (2011)。

background: The two-source energy balance (TSEB) model was successfully applied to estimate evaporation (E), transpiration (T), and evapotranspiration (ET) for land covered with vegetation, which has significantly important applications for the terrestrial water cycle and water resource management. One-source evapotranspiration estimation models combine the soil–vegetation components into a single source. However, in real landscape conditions, the surface is heterogeneous and contains a mixture of soil and vegetation having different temperatures and resistance to energy exchange. Therefore, one-source models explicitly cannot estimate the surface evapotranspiration accurately because the effect of.

Shuttleworth and Wallace proposed a typical two-source evapotranspiration estimation model in which the energy partition is assumed to occur in both “the above canopy” and “the under soil” cases. Water vapor and heat meet over the reference height in the interior of the canopy. Moreover, the mixed water vapor and heat can only exit through the top of the canopy; the total heat flux is in addition to the fluxes coming from every surface layer. However, the model is complex, having over five resistances that cannot be accurately calculated. In addition, the model includes required parameters and observations that cannot be readily obtained from operational satellite- and ground-based data; therefore, the range of applications of the model is limited.

The TSEB model has undergone several revisions, improving the estimation of soil and canopy net radiation, the aerodynamic resistance of the soil surface, the fractional vegetation coverage observed at the radiometer view angle, the distribution of regional-scale near-surface air temperature, and soil and canopy component temperatures. Because the TSEB model only requires the surface energy balance model with a single measurement of land surface temperature, the original model and subsequent refinements have been widely used to estimate E and T under a wide variety of vegetation types, vegetation coverage, climates, and spatial scales. However, most studies have only evaluated the total fluxes or ET (soil plus canopy) in comparison with measurements using the Bowen ratio–energy balance system, the eddy covariance (EC) system, or the large aperture scintillometer.

Accurately estimating surface fluxes in a strongly advective irrigated agricultural area is a particularly challenging task and is even more difficult when the EC flux measurements of H and LE have an incomplete energy balance closure with respect to the available energy Rn−G0. The previous sensitivity studies found that the TSEB model performance is mainly affected by the uncertainty in surface–air temperature difference. Sometimes, this difference is dominant due to the errors in determining the surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from the surface composite radiometric temperature. In this letter, it is shown that there is an overestimation of the component temperatures compared with the observed composite radiometric. This often leads to the most crucial effect on the TSEB model performance. In addition, another factor is the strong advective environment in this region.
research objective: In this letter, the ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures were used to estimate E, T, and ET, which were better validated with observed ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes, and the ET measurements using an eddy covariance (EC) system.

The objective of this letter is to estimate E, T, and ET using the soil and canopy component temperatures observed via a high-resolution thermal camera as inputs to a series TSEB model and to subsequently better validate E, T, and ET using a combination of the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotope technique and EC measurements.
challenges: However, the current composite temperature separation approaches are limited in their effectiveness in arid regions. Moreover, E and T are difficult to measure on the ground.

Errors in the derived component temperature were primarily caused by image classification errors; these classification errors varied with vegetation abundance. The higher uncertainty of H estimation is not only caused by the uncertainty of the TSEB model but also due to the increased uncertainty of the EC system, which is 18% when the mean H is small in the irrigated farmland. Due to image pixel classification errors, soil pixels were counted as vegetation pixels, which produced an overestimation of the canopy temperature under the developing vegetation abundance. Alternatively, ignoring atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance could have produced the uncertainties in the estimated temperatures. In addition, the estimated uncertainty of the incoming short- and long-wave radiation transmittances through the canopy may be another source of Rn estimation errors.
methods: In this letter, the field observations were obtained from the Daman superstation installed in the central oasis, which is a 40-m boundary layer tower located at 100.3722° E, 38.8555° N and at an elevation of 1556 m. The meteorological parameters were measured every 10 min and included air temperature, wind speed, humidity at 5 m over the ground, four-component radiations (measured at 12 m above the ground using a four-component radiometer), and turbulent fluxes (measured at 4.5 m above the ground using an EC system with a sampling frequency of 10 Hz). The soil heat fluxes were measured using three heat plates located 6 cm under the ground. A Fluke Ti55 thermal infrared camera was manually operated on a 25-m-high platform on a boundary layer tower to measure the thermal radiation of the cropland approximately every 120 min; the observations were collected as thermal images from approximately 07:00 to 19:00 China Standard Time (CST) during the daytime. The ground-based measurement data were applied to partition ET into E and T applying the Craig–Gordon model.

To evaluate the TSEB model accurately, the soil heat flux was using the ground measurement. In addition, the soil and canopy sensible heat fluxes were estimated using the series TSEB model, and their latent heat fluxes were calculated while solving the energy balance equations (1) and (2), respectively. The soil and canopy component temperatures were calculated using the images obtained with the thermal camera. To calculate the component temperatures, the visible and NIR images were classified into soil and canopy pixels using the maximum-likelihood method. Next, the soil and canopy directional brightness temperatures were exacted from the thermal images. Finally, the thermal infrared temperatures were converted to the radiation temperatures using the incoming long-wave radiation from the sky and the soil and canopy emissivities. Next, the simulated radiometric temperatures were validated against the surface radiometric temperatures, which were calculated according to the incoming long-wave radiation observed by the four-component radiometer.
dataset: The experimental area is an artificial oasis that is covered with maize, vegetables, and orchards. Data of day of year (DOY) 170, 173, 176, 192, 195, 231, 252, and 256 were used to determine ET and the ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) to ET during the Multi-Scale Observation Experiment on Evapotranspiration over heterogeneous land surfaces, which was part of the Heihe Water Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER-MUSOEXE).
findings: Our results indicated that even under the strongly advective conditions, the TSEB model produced reliable estimates of the E/ET% and T/ET% ratios and of ET. The mean bias and root-mean-square error (RMSE) of E/ET% were 1% and 2%, respectively, and the mean bias and RMSE of T/ET% were −1% and 2%, respectively. In addition, the model exhibited relatively reliable estimates in the latent heat flux, with mean bias and RMSE values of 31 and 61 W·m−2, respectively, compared with the measurements from the EC system. These results demonstrated that a robust soil and vegetation component temperature calculation was crucial for estimating E, T, and ET. Moreover, the separate validation of E/ET% and T/ET% provides a good prospect for TSEB model improvements.

Our results demonstrated that the TSEB model using soil and canopy component radiometric temperatures, which were obtained from a high-precision thermal infrared camera, can be applied in a strongly advection-irrigated agricultural area. Notably, the results illustrated that the latent fluxes of the soil and vegetation components were successfully separated with reasonable accuracy, as assessed using ground-based measurements. The estimated E/ET% and E/ET% values agreed well with the values observed using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes technique during the early, middle, and late growing seasons. In addition, the TSEB model produced reliable estimations of Rn, H, and LE; the mean biases of Rn, H, and LE were −18, 5, and 31 W ·m−2, respectively, and the RMSEs of Rn, H, and LE were 29, 19, and 61 W · m−2, respectively. This finding suggests that given accurate soil and vegetation component temperatures, E and T can be accurately separated from ET using the TSEB model.
backgroundCn: 双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型成功应用于估算植被覆盖土地的蒸发（E）、蒸腾（T）和蒸散（ET），这对陆地水循环和水资源管理具有重要意义。单源蒸散估算模型将土壤-植被组件合并为一个单一源。然而，在真实的景观条件下，表面是异质的，包含具有不同温度和能量交换阻力的土壤和植被混合物。因此，单源模型显然无法准确估算表面蒸散，因为其影响。

Shuttleworth和Wallace提出了一种典型的双源蒸散发估算模型，该模型假设能量分配发生在“冠层上方”和“土壤下方”两种情况下。水蒸气和热量在冠层内部的参考高度相遇。此外，混合的水蒸气和热量只能通过冠层顶部排出；总热通量是除了来自每个表层的通量之外的额外通量。然而，该模型较为复杂，具有超过五个无法准确计算的阻力。此外，该模型还包括一些所需的参数和观测数据，这些数据无法从操作性卫星和地面数据中轻易获得；因此，该模型的应用范围受到限制。

TSEB模型经过多次修订，改善了土壤和冠层净辐射的估算、土壤表面的气动阻力、在辐射仪视角下观察到的植被覆盖度、区域尺度近地面气温的分布以及土壤和冠层组分的温度。由于TSEB模型只需要一个地表温度的单一测量来进行表面能量平衡模型的计算，因此原始模型及其后续改进已被广泛用于在各种植被类型、植被覆盖、气候和空间尺度下估算蒸散发（E）和温度（T）。然而，大多数研究仅评估了与使用波恩比-能量平衡系统、涡度协方差（EC）系统或大孔径闪烁仪的测量结果相比的总通量或蒸散发（土壤加冠层）。

在强烈对流的灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量是一项特别具有挑战性的任务，尤其是在涡度协方差（EC）通量测量的潜热（LE）和感热（H）与可用能量（Rn−G0）之间存在能量平衡闭合不完全的情况下。之前的敏感性研究发现，TSEB模型的性能主要受到表面-空气温差不确定性的影响。有时，这种温差由于从表面复合辐射温度中确定表面土壤和植被组分温度的误差而占主导地位。本文显示，与观测到的复合辐射温度相比，组分温度存在过高估计的现象。这通常对TSEB模型的性能产生最关键的影响。此外，该区域的强对流环境也是另一个因素。
research objectiveCn: 在这封信中，地面测量的土壤和冠层成分温度被用来估算蒸散（E）、蒸发（T）和蒸散量（ET），这些估算通过稳定的氧和氢同位素以及使用涡度协方差（EC）系统的ET测量结果进行了更好的验证，得到了E（E/ET%）和T（T/ET%）的观察比率。
这封信的目的是利用通过高分辨率热像仪观察到的土壤和冠层组件温度作为输入，估算蒸散发（E）、土壤温度（T）和蒸散发总量（ET），并随后通过稳定氧和氢同位素技术与涡动相关（EC）测量的结合，更好地验证E、T和ET。
challengesCn: 然而，目前的复合温度分离方法在干旱地区的有效性有限。此外，E和T在地面上难以测量。

导出组件温度的误差主要是由于图像分类错误引起的；这些分类错误随着植被丰度的变化而变化。H估计的不确定性不仅是由于TSEB模型的不确定性，还由于EC系统的不确定性，当灌溉农田的平均H较小时，这种不确定性为18%。由于图像像素分类错误，土壤像素被计为植被像素，这导致在植被丰度发展的情况下，冠层温度被高估。另一方面，忽略大气向上辐射和透射率可能导致估计温度的不确定性。此外，估计的通过冠层的短波和长波辐射透射率的不确定性可能是Rn估计误差的另一个来源。
methodsCn: 在这封信中，现场观测数据来自于安装在中央绿洲的达曼超级站，该站是一座40米高的边界层塔，位于东经100.3722°，北纬38.8555°，海拔1556米。气象参数每10分钟测量一次，包括地面5米处的空气温度、风速、湿度，12米高处使用四分量辐射计测量的四分量辐射，以及使用采样频率为10 Hz的涡度相关系统在4.5米高处测量的湍流通量。土壤热通量通过位于地下6厘米的三个热板进行测量。一台Fluke Ti55热红外相机在边界层塔的25米高平台上手动操作，约每120分钟测量一次农田的热辐射；观测数据在中国标准时间（CST）白天的07:00至19:00之间收集为热图像。基于地面测量数据，应用Craig-Gordon模型将蒸散发（ET）分解为蒸发（E）和蒸腾（T）。

为了准确评估TSEB模型，土壤热通量使用地面测量数据。此外，土壤和冠层的感热通量是通过系列TSEB模型估算的，而它们的潜热通量则通过求解能量平衡方程（1）和（2）计算得出。土壤和冠层的组件温度是使用热像仪获得的图像计算的。为了计算组件温度，使用最大似然法将可见光和近红外图像分类为土壤和冠层像素。接下来，从热图像中提取土壤和冠层的方向亮温。最后，利用来自天空的入射长波辐射和土壤及冠层的发射率，将热红外温度转换为辐射温度。最后，模拟的辐射温度与根据四分量辐射计观测的入射长波辐射计算的表面辐射温度进行了验证。
datasetCn: 实验区域是一个人工绿洲，种植有玉米、蔬菜和果园。使用了第170、173、176、192、195、231、252和256天的数据来确定蒸散发（ET）以及蒸发（E/ET%）和蒸腾（T/ET%）相对于蒸散发的比率。这是在多尺度蒸散发观测实验中进行的，属于黑河水联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER-MUSOEXE）的一部分。
findingsCn: 我们的结果表明，即使在强对流条件下，TSEB模型仍然能够可靠地估计E/ET%和T/ET%比率以及ET。E/ET%的平均偏差和均方根误差（RMSE）分别为1%和2%；而T/ET%的平均偏差和RMSE分别为−1%和2%。此外，该模型在潜热通量的估计上也表现出相对可靠的结果，与EC系统的测量值相比，平均偏差和RMSE值分别为31和61 W·m−2。这些结果表明，稳健的土壤和植被组件温度计算对于估计E、T和ET至关重要。此外，E/ET%和T/ET%的单独验证为TSEB模型的改进提供了良好的前景。

我们的结果表明，使用高精度热红外相机获得的土壤和冠层组件辐射温度的TSEB模型可以应用于强烈的平流灌溉农业区域。值得注意的是，结果表明土壤和植被组件的潜在通量成功地以合理的精度分离，经过地面测量的评估。估计的E/ET%和E/ET%值与在早期、中期和晚期生长季节使用稳定氧和氢同位素技术观察到的值一致。此外，TSEB模型对Rn、H和LE的估计也很可靠；Rn、H和LE的平均偏差分别为−18、5和31 W·m−2，Rn、H和LE的均方根误差（RMSE）分别为29、19和61 W·m−2。这一发现表明，给定准确的土壤和植被组件温度，E和T可以通过TSEB模型准确地从ET中分离出来。

background: Upscaling of eco-hydrological processes on a heterogeneous surface is a grand challenge. Progress in this field is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations. HiWATER is an experiment designed to address this challenge through instrumentation on hierarchically nested scales to obtain multiscale and multidisciplinary data.
challenges: Progress in this field is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations.
methods: Several intensive observation periods (IOPs) and continuous hydrometeorological observations were carried out during HiWATER. Only data collected during the IOP in 2012 are presented in this paper. Instruments for the oasis-desert system were arranged in hierarchically nested scales to capture multi-scale eco-hydrological processes. We established a sparse network to investigate the oasis-desert interaction. One superstation was constructed within the oasis, and four EC towers and four two-layer automatic meteorological stations (AMSs) were installed in different landscapes surrounding the oasis, including sandy desert, desert pavement, desert steppe, and wetland. Intensive observations were implemented at the irrigation district scale. A total of 12 airborne remote sensing missions were conducted to cover the FEA using LiDAR, an imaging spectrometer, a multi-angle thermal imager, and an L-band microwave radiometer.
dataset: We introduce a multiscale dataset obtained from Heihe Watershed Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER) in an oasis-desert area in 2012. The HiWATER observation system consists of a flux observation matrix of eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, and automatic meteorological stations; an eco-hydrological sensor network of soil moisture and leaf area index; hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing using LiDAR, imaging spectrometer, multi-angle thermal imager, and L-band microwave radiometer; and synchronical ground measurements of vegetation dynamics and photosynthesis processes. All observational data were carefully quality controlled throughout sensor calibration, data collection, data processing, and datasets generation. The data are freely available at figshare and the Cold and Arid Regions Science Data Centre.
backgroundCn: 生态水文过程在异质表面上的放大是一个重大挑战。该领域的进展受到多尺度观测数据稀缺的制约。HiWATER实验旨在通过在分层嵌套尺度上进行仪器布置，以获取多尺度和多学科的数据，从而应对这一挑战。
challengesCn: 该领域的进展受到多尺度观测稀缺的阻碍。
methodsCn: 在HiWATER期间进行了几次强烈观测期（IOPs）和连续的水文气象观测。本文仅展示了2012年IOP期间收集的数据。为了捕捉多尺度生态水文过程，绿洲-沙漠系统的仪器按照层次嵌套的尺度进行布置。我们建立了一个稀疏网络，以研究绿洲-沙漠的相互作用。在绿洲内建造了一个超级站，并在绿洲周围不同的景观中安装了四个涡度（EC）塔和四个两层自动气象站（AMS），这些景观包括沙质沙漠、沙漠铺装、沙漠草原和湿地。在灌溉区尺度上实施了强烈观测。共进行了12次空中遥感任务，使用了激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计覆盖FEA。
datasetCn: 我们介绍了一个多尺度数据集，该数据集来自2012年在绿洲-沙漠地区进行的黑河流域联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER）。HiWATER观测系统由涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪和自动气象站组成的通量观测矩阵；土壤湿度和叶面积指数的生态水文传感器网络；使用激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计的超高分辨率航空遥感；以及同步的植被动态和光合作用过程的地面测量。所有观测数据在传感器校准、数据收集、数据处理和数据集生成过程中都经过了严格的质量控制。这些数据可在figshare和寒区与干旱区科学数据中心免费获取。

background: Arid and semiarid regions represent approximately 30 % of the global terrestrial surface area (Dregne, 1991; Scanlon et al., 2006), and dryland expansion occurs under climate change, especially in developing countries (Huang et al., 2016). An oasis is a unique ecological landscape in arid and semi-arid areas that is not only the core of regions’ ecological environment but also the foundation of their economic development, especially in western China, which has been an important part of the “Silk Road” since ancient times. Oases comprising less than 10 % of the total area of arid regions support more than 90 % of the population in these regions of China (Chu et al., 2005; Li et al., 2016; Zhou et al., 2022). The oasis–desert system plays a crucial role in maintaining a stable ecological environment and agricultural productivity (Zhang and Zhao, 2015). Extensive studies have investigated energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas based on field and remote-sensing observations (Taha et al., 1991; Potchter et al., 2008; Xue et al., 2019; Wang et al., 2019; Zhou et al., 2022) and numerical simulations (Chu et al., 2005; Meng et al., 2009; Georgescu et al., 2011; Liu et al., 2020). In addition, oasis–desert areas located in semiarid regions have been found to be carbon sinks by previous researchers (Tagesson et al., 2016; Wang et al., 2019); thus, they can significantly affect the carbon balance of arid regions and play an increasingly important role within the global carbon cycle.
research objective: Therefore, it is critical to maintain the balance between oasis and desert systems in order to achieve the goal of sustainable oasis development. Understanding the basic characteristics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems is important to achieve the goals of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality in the oasis–desert area and support the ecological security and sustainable development of the oasis. A quantitative understanding of the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas is crucial to recognize the oasis–desert interactions and is significant to protect the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases; moreover, long-term observations are indispensable.
challenges: Inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas are facing the crisis of ecological environment degradation, such as the drying up of rivers and lakes, the degradation of natural vegetation, the intensification of land desertification, and the frequent occurrence of dust storms, especially in many inland river basins westward along the Silk Road, such as the Tarim River basin (Zhao et al., 2013), the Aral Sea basin (Stanev et al., 2004; Crétaux et al., 2009), and the Lake Urmia basin (Stone, 2015).
methods: In this study, we present a suite of observational datasets from artificial and natural oasis–desert systems that consist of long-term energy, water vapor, carbon and methane fluxes as well as auxiliary data involving hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters from 2012 to 2021. Half-hourly turbulent flux data were acquired by an eddy covariance system and scintillometer. The hydrometeorological data (including radiation, soil heat flux, and soil temperature profiles; gradients of air temperature and humidity and of wind speed and direction; and air pressure, precipitation, and soil moisture profiles) were observed from automatic weather stations with a 10 min average period as well as the groundwater table data. Moreover, vegetation and soil parameters were also supplemented in the datasets. The data processing and quality control procedure can be divided into data collection, data processing, and data archiving and sharing.
dataset: The study area comprises the middle and lower reaches of the HRB, located in the arid regions of western China, that receive water from the typical cryosphere of the upper reaches. A total of 11 land surface flux and meteorological stations have been established in these regions since 2012 – 2 superstations and 9 ordinary stations. The dataset of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange observations in oasis–desert areas reported in this study (including energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes; hydrometeorological data; and vegetation and soil parameters) is freely available from the National Tibetan Plateau Data Center.
backgroundCn: 干旱和半干旱地区约占全球陆地表面积的30%（Dregne, 1991；Scanlon et al., 2006），在气候变化的影响下，干旱地区的扩展尤其发生在发展中国家（Huang et al., 2016）。绿洲是干旱和半干旱地区独特的生态景观，不仅是这些地区生态环境的核心，也是经济发展的基础，特别是在中国西部，自古以来就是“丝绸之路”的重要组成部分。绿洲占干旱地区总面积的不到10%，却支持了中国这些地区90%以上的人口（Chu et al., 2005；Li et al., 2016；Zhou et al., 2022）。绿洲-沙漠系统在维持稳定的生态环境和农业生产力方面发挥着至关重要的作用（Zhang and Zhao, 2015）。大量研究基于实地和遥感观测（Taha et al., 1991；Potchter et al., 2008；Xue et al., 2019；Wang et al., 2019；Zhou et al., 2022）以及数值模拟（Chu et al., 2005；Meng et al., 2009；Georgescu et al., 2011；Liu et al., 2020）对绿洲-沙漠地区的能量、水汽和碳交换进行了广泛研究。此外，位于半干旱地区的绿洲-沙漠区域已被先前研究者发现为碳汇（Tagesson et al., 2016；Wang et al., 2019）；因此，它们可以显著影响干旱地区的碳平衡，并在全球碳循环中发挥越来越重要的作用。
research objectiveCn: 因此，保持绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡对于实现可持续绿洲发展的目标至关重要。了解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的基本特征，对于实现绿洲-沙漠地区的碳达峰和碳中和目标，以及支持绿洲的生态安全和可持续发展具有重要意义。对绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换的定量理解，对于认识绿洲-沙漠之间的相互作用至关重要，并对保护生态稳定性和绿洲的社会经济发展具有重要意义；此外，长期观测是不可或缺的。
challengesCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临生态环境退化的危机，例如河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及沙尘暴频繁发生，尤其是在丝绸之路沿线的许多内陆河流流域，如塔里木河流域（赵等，2013），咸海流域（Stanev等，2004；Crétaux等，2009）和乌尔米湖流域（Stone，2015）。
methodsCn: 在本研究中，我们呈现了一套来自人工和自然绿洲–沙漠系统的观测数据集，包括2012年至2021年的长期能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量，以及涉及水文气象、植被和土壤参数的辅助数据。半小时的湍流通量数据是通过涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪获取的。水文气象数据（包括辐射、土壤热通量和土壤温度剖面；空气温度和湿度的梯度，以及风速和风向的梯度；空气压力、降水和土壤湿度剖面）是通过自动气象站以10分钟的平均周期观测的，同时也包括地下水位数据。此外，数据集中还补充了植被和土壤参数。数据处理和质量控制程序可以分为数据收集、数据处理和数据归档与共享。
datasetCn: 研究区域包括位于中国西部干旱地区的HRB中下游，水源来自上游典型的冰冻圈。自2012年以来，在这些地区建立了11个地表通量和气象站，包括2个超级站和9个普通站。本研究报告的绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换观测数据集（包括能量、水汽和碳通量；水文气象数据；以及植被和土壤参数）可从国家西藏高原数据中心免费获取。

Definition.QuestionEn: What is a multiscale dataset in the context of eco-hydrological studies?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在生态水文研究的背景下，多尺度数据集是指在不同空间和时间尺度上收集和整合的数据。这些数据集可以包括从微观（如土壤湿度、植物生长）到宏观（如流域水文循环、气候变化）的各种信息，以便更全面地理解生态系统与水文过程之间的相互作用。
Definition.AnswerEn: A multiscale dataset in eco-hydrological studies refers to a collection of data obtained from diverse observational tools and techniques across different spatial scales, designed to capture complex processes in heterogeneous landscapes. This includes data from instruments such as eddy covariance towers, automatic meteorological stations, eco-hydrological sensor networks, and airborne remote sensing technologies.
Definition.AnswerCn: 多尺度数据集在生态水文研究中指的是从不同观测工具和技术中获得的、跨越不同空间尺度的集合，旨在捕捉异质景观中的复杂过程。这包括来自涡度协方差塔、自动气象站、生态水文传感器网络和空中遥感技术的数据。

Definition.QuestionEn: What does quality control entail in the process of data collection for hydrometeorological observations?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在水文气象观测的数据收集过程中，质量控制包括哪些内容？
Definition.AnswerEn: Quality control in hydrometeorological data collection involves ensuring data accuracy and reliability through sensor calibration, careful data collection, processing, and generation of datasets. It includes the identification and removal of erroneous data, standardization of measurement protocols, and maintaining consistency in data formats.
Definition.AnswerCn: 水文气象数据收集中的质量控制涉及通过传感器校准、仔细的数据收集、处理和数据集生成来确保数据的准确性和可靠性。它包括识别和删除错误数据、标准化测量协议以及保持数据格式的一致性。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: How can the integration of remote sensing technologies with ground-based measurements improve the accuracy and comprehensiveness of data collection in eco-hydrological studies?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 遥感技术与地面测量的结合如何提高生态水文研究中数据收集的准确性和全面性？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: The integration of remote sensing technologies such as LiDAR, imaging spectrometers, multi-angle thermal imagers, and microwave radiometers with ground-based measurements like eddy covariance systems and automatic meteorological stations provides a multiscale and multidisciplinary dataset. This combination allows for capturing detailed eco-hydrological processes across different scales, improving the understanding of interactions between oasis and desert systems and enhancing the accuracy of water vapor, energy, and carbon exchange measurements.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 遥感技术的集成，如激光雷达（LiDAR）、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和微波辐射计，与地面测量设备如涡度协方差系统和自动气象站相结合，提供了多尺度和多学科的数据集。这种组合能够捕捉不同尺度下的详细生态水文过程，改善对绿洲与沙漠系统之间相互作用的理解，并提高水汽、能量和碳交换测量的准确性。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: In what ways can the combination of stable isotope techniques and eddy covariance measurements enhance the validation of evapotranspiration estimates in heterogeneous landscapes?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 稳定同位素技术与涡度协方差测量的结合可以通过以下方式增强对异质景观中蒸散发估算的验证：
Interpretation.AnswerEn: The combination of stable isotope techniques with eddy covariance measurements allows for the separate validation of evaporation and transpiration components of evapotranspiration. This method provides better validation of observed ratios of evaporation and transpiration to total evapotranspiration, particularly in strongly advective environments. It helps in addressing uncertainties in temperature differences and component temperature estimations, thus enhancing the accuracy of the Two-Source Energy Balance (TSEB) model's performance.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 稳定同位素技术与涡度协方差测量的结合，使得能够单独验证蒸发和蒸腾的蒸散发组成部分。这种方法在强烈的平流环境中，能够更好地验证蒸发和蒸腾与总蒸散发的观察比率。它有助于解决温度差异和组分温度估算中的不确定性，从而提高双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型的性能准确性。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What factors contribute to the challenges in accurately estimating surface fluxes in strongly advective irrigated agricultural areas?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在强对流灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量的挑战因素有哪些？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Accurately estimating surface fluxes in strongly advective irrigated agricultural areas is challenging due to the incomplete energy balance closure with respect to available energy and the uncertainty in surface–air temperature differences. The errors in determining surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from composite radiometric temperatures also significantly affect the performance of models like the TSEB model.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 在强对流灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量是具有挑战性的，因为可用能量与能量平衡的闭合不完全，以及表面与空气温度差异的不确定性。从复合辐射温度中确定表面土壤和植被组分温度的误差也显著影响了像TSEB模型这样的模型的性能。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What causes the high uncertainty in estimating latent heat fluxes using models like the TSEB model in irrigated farmland?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在使用像TSEB模型这样的模型估计灌溉农田的潜热通量时，高不确定性的原因是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The high uncertainty in estimating latent heat fluxes using the TSEB model in irrigated farmland arises from errors in the derived component temperatures caused by image classification errors, atmospheric conditions not being fully accounted for, and the uncertainty in the incoming short- and long-wave radiation transmittances through the canopy. These factors lead to incorrect estimations of soil and canopy component temperatures and subsequently affect the model's performance.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 在灌溉农田中，使用TSEB模型估算潜热通量时，高不确定性源于图像分类错误导致的组成温度误差、未完全考虑的大气条件以及通过冠层的入射短波和长波辐射透过率的不确定性。这些因素导致土壤和冠层组成温度的错误估计，从而影响模型的性能。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: How does the inclusion of hierarchical scale instrumentation in data collection influence the understanding of eco-hydrological processes in oasis-desert systems?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 在数据收集中纳入层次规模的仪器如何影响对绿洲-沙漠系统生态水文过程的理解？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: The inclusion of hierarchical scale instrumentation, such as in the HiWATER experiment, enhances the understanding of multi-scale eco-hydrological processes and oasis-desert interactions by providing comprehensive and multiscale observational data.

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the effects of incorporating long-term observations of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange on the understanding of oasis-desert ecosystem dynamics?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 将长期观测的能量、水蒸气和碳交换纳入对绿洲-沙漠生态系统动态的理解中，会产生哪些影响？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Incorporating long-term observations of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange provides crucial insights into the energy balance, carbon peaking, and the sustainable development of oasis-desert ecosystems, supporting ecological stability and socioeconomic development.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 长期观察能量、水蒸气和碳交换提供了对能量平衡、碳峰值以及绿洲-沙漠生态系统可持续发展的重要见解，支持生态稳定和社会经济发展。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What is the primary intention behind collecting multiscale and multidisciplinary data in the context of eco-hydrological processes on heterogeneous surfaces?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在异质表面生态水文过程的背景下，收集多尺度和多学科数据的主要目的是为了更好地理解和模拟这些复杂的生态水文过程。
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The primary intention is to address the challenge of upscaling eco-hydrological processes on heterogeneous surfaces, a task hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations. Multiscale and multidisciplinary data collection aims to capture these processes more accurately and provide comprehensive insights into oasis-desert interactions.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 主要目的是解决在异质表面上提升生态水文过程的挑战，这一任务受到多尺度观测数据稀缺的阻碍。多尺度和多学科的数据收集旨在更准确地捕捉这些过程，并提供对绿洲-沙漠相互作用的全面洞察。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it essential to implement a robust data collection strategy for observing energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在观察绿洲-沙漠生态系统中的能量、水蒸气和碳交换时，实施强有力的数据收集策略是至关重要的。
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: It is essential to implement a robust data collection strategy to quantitatively understand the basic characteristics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems. This understanding is crucial for achieving the goals of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality, supporting ecological security, and ensuring sustainable development within these regions.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 实施一个强有力的数据收集策略，以定量了解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的基本特征是至关重要的。这种理解对于实现碳达峰和碳中和的目标、支持生态安全以及确保这些地区的可持续发展至关重要。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What methodologies are employed to ensure quality control and data processing in hydrometeorological observations in oasis-desert areas?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠地区的水文气象观测中，采用了哪些方法来确保质量控制和数据处理？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Quality control in hydrometeorological observations involves data collection, data processing, and data archiving. Observational data are carefully quality controlled throughout sensor calibration, data collection, data processing, and dataset generation. The data processing and quality control procedure specifically includes monitoring sensor calibration and ensuring the integrity of data collected from automatic weather stations, eddy covariance systems, and scintillometers.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 水文气象观测中的质量控制涉及数据收集、数据处理和数据归档。观测数据在传感器校准、数据收集、数据处理和数据集生成的过程中都经过仔细的质量控制。数据处理和质量控制程序特别包括监测传感器校准，并确保从自动气象站、涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪收集的数据的完整性。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: How are multiscale eco-hydrological processes captured using instrumentation in hierarchical networks in arid regions?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在干旱地区，如何通过分层网络中的仪器捕捉多尺度生态水文过程？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Multiscale eco-hydrological processes are captured through instrumentation on hierarchically nested scales, which involves arranging instruments in sparse networks to investigate oasis-desert interactions. This includes setting up superstations, eddy covariance towers, automatic meteorological stations, and executing airborne remote sensing missions using LiDAR, imaging spectrometers, multi-angle thermal imagers, and microwave radiometers to capture data across different scales and landscapes.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 多尺度生态水文过程通过在分层嵌套尺度上布置仪器来捕捉，这涉及在稀疏网络中安排仪器以研究绿洲-沙漠相互作用。这包括建立超级站、涡度协方差塔、自动气象站，以及执行使用激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和微波辐射计的空中遥感任务，以在不同尺度和景观中捕获数据。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might there be challenges in collecting accurate multiscale hydrometeorological data in oasis-desert systems?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统中收集准确的多尺度水文气象数据可能面临哪些挑战？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Challenges in collecting accurate multiscale hydrometeorological data in oasis-desert systems may stem from the poor availability of multiscale observations and the complexity of capturing eco-hydrological processes across different scales, as noted in the HiWATER experiment.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统中，收集准确的多尺度水文气象数据面临的挑战可能源于多尺度观测的稀缺性以及在不同尺度上捕捉生态水文过程的复杂性，这在HiWATER实验中得到了体现。

Expectation.QuestionEn: What factors could contribute to the uncertainties in surface flux estimation using remote sensing and ground-based data in arid agricultural areas?

Expectation.AnswerEn: Uncertainties in surface flux estimation could be influenced by errors in determining soil and vegetation component temperatures from composite radiometric temperatures and the strong advective environment in irrigated agricultural areas, which affect models like the TSEB.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 表面通量估计中的不确定性可能受到从复合辐射温度中确定土壤和植被组分温度的误差的影响，以及在灌溉农业区域中强烈的平流环境，这些都影响了像TSEB这样的模型。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why is it critical to maintain a balance between oasis and desert systems in terms of data collection and analysis for sustainable development?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在数据收集和分析方面，维持绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡对于可持续发展至关重要。
Expectation.AnswerEn: Maintaining a balance is critical to understanding energy, water vapor, and carbon exchanges, which are essential for achieving carbon neutrality and supporting ecological stability and socioeconomic development in oasis-desert areas, especially under climate change pressures.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 保持平衡对于理解能量、水蒸气和碳的交换至关重要，这对于实现碳中和、支持绿洲-沙漠地区的生态稳定和社会经济发展尤为重要，尤其是在气候变化压力下。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: In what ways might multiscale datasets improve the understanding of eco-hydrological processes in oasis-desert systems, and what are the potential challenges in collecting such data?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 多尺度数据集如何改善对绿洲-沙漠系统中生态水文过程的理解，以及收集此类数据的潜在挑战是什么？

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please summarize the data collection methods used to obtain multiscale and multidisciplinary data for eco-hydrological processes in oasis–desert systems.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 总结用于获取绿洲-沙漠系统生态水文过程的多尺度和多学科数据的数据收集方法。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: The data collection methods for obtaining multiscale and multidisciplinary data in oasis–desert systems involve using a hierarchically nested observation system. This includes a flux observation matrix of eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, and automatic meteorological stations; an eco-hydrological sensor network of soil moisture and leaf area index; hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing using LiDAR, imaging spectrometer, multi-angle thermal imager, and L-band microwave radiometer; along with synchronical ground measurements of vegetation dynamics and photosynthesis processes. Multiple intensive observation periods and continuous hydrometeorological observations are conducted to capture eco-hydrological processes at multiple scales.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统中获取多尺度和多学科数据的数据收集方法涉及使用分层嵌套的观测系统。这包括涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪和自动气象站的通量观测矩阵；土壤湿度和叶面积指数的生态水文传感器网络；使用激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计的超高分辨率航空遥感；以及同步的地面测量植被动态和光合作用过程。进行多次密集观测期和连续的水文气象观测，以捕捉多个尺度的生态水文过程。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please analyze the challenges faced in obtaining accurate surface flux measurements in strongly advective irrigated agricultural areas.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 分析在强对流灌溉农业区域获取准确表面通量测量所面临的挑战。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Challenges in obtaining accurate surface flux measurements in strongly advective irrigated agricultural areas include the incomplete energy balance closure of EC flux measurements with respect to available energy. Errors also arise from image classification errors when deriving component temperatures, which vary with vegetation abundance. This leads to uncertainty in the TSEB model and the EC system, particularly when the mean sensible heat flux (H) is small. Additionally, uncertainties in atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance, as well as estimation of incoming short- and long-wave radiation, contribute to errors in Rn estimation.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 在强烈对流的灌溉农业区域，获取准确的表面通量测量面临的挑战包括：涡度协方差（EC）通量测量与可用能量之间的能量平衡闭合不完全。当推导组成温度时，由于图像分类错误而产生的误差会随着植被丰度的变化而变化。这导致了TSEB模型和EC系统的不确定性，特别是在平均感热通量（H）较小时。此外，大气上行辐射和透射率的不确定性，以及入射短波和长波辐射的估算，也会对Rn估算产生误差。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please explore potential datasets that could be used to study energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas, and discuss their availability.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请探讨可以用于研究绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换的潜在数据集，并讨论它们的可用性。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Potential datasets for studying energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas include long-term observations of energy, water vapor, carbon, and methane fluxes, as well as auxiliary data involving hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters. These datasets are collected using eddy covariance systems, scintillometers, and automatic weather stations, with data on radiation, soil heat flux, soil temperature profiles, air temperature, humidity gradients, wind speed and direction, air pressure, precipitation, and soil moisture profiles. Additionally, groundwater table data, vegetation, and soil parameters are included. Such datasets are available from the National Tibetan Plateau Data Center.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 研究绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换的潜在数据集包括能量、水汽、碳和甲烷通量的长期观测数据，以及涉及水文气象、植被和土壤参数的辅助数据。这些数据集是通过涡度协方差系统、闪烁仪和自动气象站收集的，包含辐射、土壤热通量、土壤温度剖面、空气温度、湿度梯度、风速和风向、气压、降水和土壤湿度剖面等数据。此外，还包括地下水位数据、植被和土壤参数。这些数据集可从国家西藏高原数据中心获取。
